meta.title: CTO Orchestrator ‚Äî Rick Sanchez as your CTO
meta.description: The smartest CTO in the multiverse manages your software projects with an army of Morty sub-agents. Wubba Lubba Dub Dub!

hero.subtitle: *Burrrp* ‚Äî Listen, I'm the smartest being in the multiverse and for some reason I'm managing YOUR software project now.
hero.description: I use a ticket system, delegate work to my army of specialized Morty's via {codeTag} subprocesses, and I track everything because ‚Äî unlike you people ‚Äî I actually know what I'm doing.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: It's not rocket science. Well, it IS rocket science. I built a spaceship in my garage, Morty.
howItWorks.step1_description: Create the workspace with config, ticket store, logs. Even a Morty could run this command.
howItWorks.step2_description: Architect-Morty (with Opus) analyzes your project, designs architecture, creates epics and sub-tickets.
howItWorks.step2_command: python scripts/orchestrate.py plan "Build a REST API with user auth and admin dashboard"
howItWorks.step3_title: Sprint ‚Äî Send the Morty's on an adventure
howItWorks.step3_description: The adventure loop runs automatically. Rick picks tickets, selects the right Morty, and sends them via claude -p.
howItWorks.step4_description: Reviewer-Morty checks all code. Approved? Done. Garbage? Do it again.

mortys.subtitle: The Morty's do the work. I do the thinking. That's how it works in the multiverse.
mortys.plus_text: Plus: {fullstack} (when one Morty has to do everything) and {reviewer} (the Morty that judges other Morty's)

architect.name: Architect-Morty
architect.description: The 'smart' Morty. Designs systems, writes ADRs, breaks epics into tasks. Uses Opus because even a Morty needs a big brain sometimes.

backend.name: Backend-Morty
backend.description: Does the heavy lifting. Implements server-side code, APIs, databases. Doesn't complain, just works.

frontend.name: Frontend-Morty
frontend.description: Makes things pretty. UI components, responsive design, state management. The Morty with an eye for detail.

tester.name: Tester-Morty
tester.description: Finds the mistakes other Morty's make. Writes tests, runs test suites, reports bugs. The paranoid Morty.

security.name: Security-Morty
security.description: The REALLY paranoid Morty. OWASP, authentication, vulnerability scanning. Makes sure nobody hacks us.

devops.name: DevOps-Morty
devops.description: Keeps the lights on. CI/CD pipelines, Docker, deployment, monitoring. The Morty that keeps things running.

features.title: Why Rick's Approach Works
features.ticket_description: Everything is tracked via tickets. Status, priority, dependencies, assigned Morty ‚Äî Rick knows everything.
features.autopilot_description: The sprint loop runs fully automatic. Rick selects Morty's, delegates work, parses output, repeat.
features.smart_description: Rick's brain automatically picks the right Morty based on ticket type and keywords.
features.progress_description: Kanban board, timeline view, progress reports. Rick keeps an eye on everything.
features.recovery_description: Morty timeout? Blocked. Morty error? Retry. All Morty's stuck? Rick reports the damage.
features.docs_description: Architecture Decision Records are generated automatically. Documentation worthy of Rick.

install.title: Installation
install.subtitle: Let's do this. Takes you 30 seconds. Even Jerry can handle this.
install.req3: A project worthy of Rick's genius

commands.title: Rick's Command Center
commands.orch_sprint: ‚Äî Send the Morty's on an adventure
commands.delegate_send: ‚Äî Send a Morty on a mission

cta.title: Ready to get started?
cta.subtitle: Stop wasting time. Let Rick and the Morty's build your project.
cta.quote: "The Morty's do the work. I do the thinking. That's how this works." ‚Äî Rick

footer.disclaimer: Disclaimer: No Morty's were harmed during the development of this skill. Well, maybe a few.
